intro: Casearia orizabana, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a shrub native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, bright purple berries that appear in the fall. These berries are not only visually striking but also serve as a food source for various birds and small mammals. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly glossy texture, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
